title: Black Beans and Rice Recipe
description: Black beans and rice flavored with garlic, cumin, and cayenne pepper makes a wholesome, budget-friendly, vegetarian meal or tasty side dish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Rice Beans and Rice Recipes Black Beans and Rice 4.3 (1,347) 992 Reviews 87 Photos Black beans and rice make a great 30-minute vegetarian meal that's filling, delicious, and cheap! Great as a side dish or in a burrito bowl, too. Submitted by Eileen Mintz Updated on October 8, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 87 87 87 87 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 teaspoon olive oil 1 onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, minced ¾ cup uncooked white rice 1 ½ cups low sodium, low fat vegetable broth 3 ½ cups canned black beans, drained 1 teaspoon ground cumin ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion has softened, about 4 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in rice to coat; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce to a simmer, and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in beans, cumin, and cayenne; cook until beans are warmed through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: This recipe is from The WEBB Cooks by Robyn Webb, courtesy of the American Diabetes Association. I Made It Print 2,011 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 140 Calories 1g Fat 27g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 140 % Daily Value * Total Fat 1g 1% Saturated Fat 0g 1% Sodium 354mg 15% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 6g 22% Total Sugars 1g Protein 6g 13% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 39mg 3% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 298mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Black Beans and Rice 01 of 87 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 87 Photo by  wildflower 11/03/2024 A keeper! I did make some changes. I put one 15 ounce can of black beans in, I think 3 cups would be too many for us. I didn’t put cayenne or cumin in it, as I also added a 10 ounce can of diced tomatoes with green chilies, lime juice and cilantro and I was worried about how spicy it would be. It’s still a bit hot for me. I added some cut up shrimp that I had. My husband liked it, but he spiced it up with some salsa. I added some sour cream and ate it on a low carb tortilla. My husband just came back for seconds! 03 of 87 Photo by  Mary Wagner 06/01/2024 Great flavors Great flavors I never made rice and beans before. I made this exactly as written and it came out perfect. I wouldn’t change a thing. 04 of 87 Photo by  ninarn 04/12/2023 Easy, delicious and fastPerfect if you have left over riceTook me all of 8 min 05 of 87 Photo by  JintheSouth 01/16/2023 I added ground chorizo. It was really good. I didn’t use cayenne, but didn’t have to with the chorizo. It gave it a nice kick. I also used brown rice instead of white. 06 of 87 Photo by  Annette Hansen 04/05/2022 Loved it! Used homemade chicken stock, because that’s what I had on hand. Added fresh tomato and sour cream as garnish. Served with tortilla chips. Great lunch! 07 of 87 Photo by  Bluiz1960 04/16/2021 08 of 87 Photo by  Bluiz1960 04/16/2021 09 of 87 Photo by  Mark 03/01/2021 I added a bit of cilantro and chipotle rub. But otherwise made as written. 10 of 87 Photo by  Mark 03/01/2021 I added a bit of cilantro and chipotle rub. But otherwise made as written. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Quick Black Beans and Rice 301 Ratings Millet-Stuffed Peppers 28 Ratings Campfire Curried Vegetable Packs Vegan Bean Taco Filling 434 Ratings Black Bean and Soy Veggie Burgers 3 Ratings Zucchini with Chickpea and Mushroom Stuffing 179 Ratings Cuban Beans and Rice 218 Ratings Rice with Black Beans 190 Ratings Chickpea Curry 647 Ratings Lentil Rice and Veggie Bake 175 Ratings Penne Pasta with Cannellini Beans and Escarole 159 Ratings Mexican Pasta 333 Ratings Quinoa Chard Pilaf 114 Ratings Mexicana Veggie Burgers 4 Ratings Cuban Black Beans 97 Ratings Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie 111 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
